description.narrative:
Project Outcomes: Access to early-stage capital and operational support leading to increased ability of startups to scale and succeed. The Fund will provide value creation by providing operational support, access to follow on funding and networks.
Contribution to Market Creation: (i) Increased competitiveness of Egypt's VC ecosystem: By continuing to demonstrate the viability of Egypt's VC ecosystem, the Fund will increase competitiveness by bringing more Fund Managers into the ecosystem. (ii) Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund's innovative investees bring new business models, sometimes into underserved parts of the country, which may bring more competitors into the market, increase efficiency and drive down market wide costs.

The proposed project consists of an IFC equity commitment of up to $15 million in Algebra Ventures II Coöperatief U.A. (Algebra II or the Fund), a venture capital fund domiciled in Netherlands with a target size of $90 million. The Fund will invest in technology startups in Egypt and opportunistically in the broader Middle East and Africa (MEA) region. A separate co-investment envelope of up to $15 million will also be part of the project.

mailing-address.narrative: Algebra Ventures II Tarek Assaad Managing Partner +01222229229 tarek@algebraventures.com G131, 171 Tahrir St, The GrEEK Campus, Cairo, Egypt www.algebraventures.com

name.narrative: Algebra II will be operating out of Cairo, Egypt. The Fund will predominantly make investments in Egypt and opportunistically in the broader Middle East and Africa region.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
